column4: so with dist-upgrade I have to reboot, whilst with upgrade only I don't have to reboot (because it does not upgrade the kernel)

No, you're confused. A "dist-upgrade" updates to another Ubuntu release entirely (e.g. Hardy to Intrepid), whereas "upgrade" will install all updates to the installed packages (including the kernel package) for the current Ubuntu version (distribution)
